Though This holy place is situated in a crowded place,but it has a great value among natives of Barabanki.The Hanumanaji's vigrah of This ancient temple is worth seeing and praying.People have great faith and loyalty for Sri Hanumanji.A huge crowd from every corner of district is gathered on all Tuesdays of Jyesth month of Panchang calendar.One must visit and pray Sri Hanuman ji at this temple as it's a place where one can get his desire fulfilled.जय श्री रामजी, जय जय श्री वीर हनुमानजी।

places_with_reviews.name: Clock Tower
places_with_reviews.address: Postal, Ghantaghar, Main Market Rd, Satyapremi Nagar, Barabanki, Uttar Pradesh 225001, India

reviews.text:
The overall experience is very good. If possible visit between 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm as during this time most food joints would be open. You can also visit it in morning before 9:00 am to enjoy the tasty breakfast options available.
On Fridays, you will be able to witness a flea market (so don't forget to check it out of love love shopping)

This is Very Charming place 💕🌹🥰
Feeling gd in Morning & Evening time.
A huge market is held here every Friday. In which all kinds of things are available.
There are many markets for gold, silver and artificial jewelery here.There are also shops selling all types of utensils like steel, copper, aluminium, iron and plastic etc.Many collections and shops of ladies and gents wear are available here. A wide variety of things to eat and drink are available. And there is a bank here also.
In this area, a market is organized on Fridays from Dhanokhar intersection to the water tank and Pirbatawan turn.In which thousands of people come. And do shopping. In which most of the people come from the female category. Both non-veg and veg items are available here. In the holy month of Ramadan, all kinds of things like sweets, biryani, kebab, sirmal, lassi, shahi tukde, halwa paratha etc. are available here. , Here the clothes worn in weddings and the bells and laces used in them are found. And bridal decoration items are also available.

The Old Clock Tower of Barabanki is a historic landmark in the city. It is a magnificent structure that stands tall and proud, and it is a symbol of the city's rich cultural heritage. The clock tower has a unique design that sets it apart from other clock towers in the region. It is a perfect example of colonial-era architecture and its intricate details are a testament to the craftsmanship of the builders of the time. The clock still works, adding to the charm of the tower. Thus it's not allowed visiting people can climb to the top of the tower and enjoy a panoramic view of the city. The tower is well-maintained and is a popular spot for tourists and locals alike. Overall, the Old Clock Tower of Barabanki is a must-visit for anyone interested in history and architecture
Lovely place to hangout with friends and family, lots of options available for your carvings.
It is not a kind of place where you visit for have fun. It remains too crowded because of traffic congestion and shops around it

Sanatan Dharma school is also along with this temple.
The students who want to learn and write Sanskrit and all about Sanatan Dharma. They can go for it.
I strongly suggest this temple to visit.
There is a Sarovar in between the temples.
Looking awesome.
Nageashwar Nath temple is situated in peerbatawan barabanki. This is a very famous temple in barabanki. Where people celebrate Aarti, mundane sanskar, pooja,-archna and other spiritual process .
